reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel location was great. Right across the street from Central Station and right at the bottom of the red light district and all those lovely coffee shops. We booked a twin room and was surprised when we where given a very large quad room. The staff were friendly and helpful. Have been to Amsterdam three times and this is by far the best place that I have stayed for a reasonable price. Will be going back to Amsterdam and will be staying at this hotel again.
reviews.title: What a location!!!!

reviews.text: Only negative was the noise from the street in the morning. Had to close the windows in the early hours cause of the road works and restaurant deliveries but the location made up for it!
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night in july. Got a great price for a wonderful clean big double room on the fourth floor with wonderful beds, big bathroom, 40 channels on the tv and a great buffe breakfast in the morning. Very close to Central Station, Center and Red light disctrict. What mote can you ask for. I'm very satisfied with the hotel, staff and the surroundings. Stay there!
reviews.title: New Year's Trip
Prinz Hendrick Hotel
reviews.text: My family, friends and I rented this hotel for a 5 day stay for New Years. We were traveling with a party of 13. We first arrived at the hotel 2 hours early. We were allowed to drop our bags underneath the staircase. I was a little nervous about leaving my belongings but when we returned to check-in we found all of our bags to be in order. The rooms seem pretty standard as far as 2-3 stars in Amsterdam go. My friends got to stay in a sweet room facing out the front of the hotel. We enjoyed many nights in the hotel bar. The bartenders that served us were great. They also exchange money but for a high exchange rate and would suggest exchanging money before arrival. We had a great time and we're glad we stayed at this hotel.

For value and location i think the Prinz Hendrick would be hard to beat, its decor is a bit tired but i have paid an awful lot more and stayed in worse hotels in Amsterdam. We had six twin rooms booked all were about the same. Each room was quite spacious and bright and all of them were clean. Housekeeping was done daily and they did a great job.
reviews.title: Unfair Reviews - Fab Hotel in an Excellent Location

likes.liked: — Our accommodation and the hotel location
likes.disliked: — The smell on the first floor

reviews.text: This hotel was chosen for me on account of its location, which is very central and certainly suited to exploring the city. However, much of what I read in other reviews was borne out by my experience; the staircase was tricky, the whole place needed a lick of paint, the smell of 'exotic' smoke permeated the building, the bedding was less than fresh smelling (with multiple cigarettes burns!) and the breakfast wasn't worth bothering with. I would say that the place seemed particularly suited for group (stag or hen) trips, where exploring the cafes and the red light district might be a priority. However, budget travelers looking for a central location may find the place meets their needs providing their expectations are more two star than three!
reviews.title: Not quite a 3 star experience

reviews.text: Stayed for a long weekend in this hotel. It was one of the more affordable options but nevertheless the hotel was clean and comfortable, the reception staff were very helpful, the bed was comfortable, and I was not disturbed by other residents. There were some noisy groups of people staying in the hotel but the soundproofing was very good so I was not disturbed. It was across the main road from Central Station so in a great location.
reviews.title: Great value for money in a good location

likes.disliked: — Breakfast was a bit of a scrum

reviews.text: The very first trip to amsterdam i chose this hotel.the place is ve
reviews.title: simplemans hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ry clean big rooms nice clean bath and ashower that never runs out of hot water great breakfast and right around the corner to some of amsterdams best coffieshops .I made a promice to myself that i would return every year that iam able 08. will make my third visit to the city of enlightingment to get amstterdamaged
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, good breakfast, and a larger than average room. However, the rooms need refurbishing and street noise will not allow much sleep. Most hotels on our 2008 European trip now have double glazed windows and they are needed here. Also I didn't like the set-up of the reception desk, as you can't see them process your credit card.
reviews.title: Feeling dirty with no sleep? This hotel is for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 5 nights in the Dam staying at the Prins Hendrik. Having been to Amsterdam a few times before I wasn't expecting much from the hotel, which is just as well. When we arrived we were told our room wasn't actually in the hotel but in the apartments just across the way. I didn't really have a problem with this until I saw the stairs! An extremely narrow and steep spiral staircase which was as difficult to get up as it was back down again. I managed to cut my hand on the rail on first attempt. It is also wooden with no carpet and very noisey when people are going up and down.
reviews.title: What I've come to expect in Amsterdam...

reviews.text: The room was dark and gloomy with very low ceilings, the decor was very dated and cheap looking. The "double bed" was actually two narrow single beds pushed together. One sheet and a very light blanket was all that covered each bed - you didn't even get to share a duvet. I was quite annoyed about this as we had arrived on valentine's day and it wasn't exactly romantic! The bathroom was adequate with a decent sized bath and ok shower. The rooms do get cleaned daily and although there were stains etc on the carpet and everything was tatty, it did seem clean.
reviews.title: Ideal for cramming people in rooms!

likes.liked: — Large rooms that can accommodate lot's of beds.
likes.disliked: — Night staff, owners a bit rude.

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok for us; a couple of options on cold meat and cheese, scrambled and boiled eggs, beans, cereal, breads and fruit. The staff are a bit hit and miss. We asked if we could leave our bags on the day we were departing the night before and told there was nowhere to put them but on the day a friendlier chap showed us a space under the stair where other people had also left their luggage.
reviews.title: Horrible Hotel RRRun

reviews.text: On the up side, the location is great, central for everything. The pea soup ordered from the bar was fab and the bar itself was friendly, busy and with a good atmosphere.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paying a £120 a night I would really look hard and fast for a better hotel for my money next time.
reviews.title: Just fine

likes.liked: — Size of the room and its location.
likes.disliked: — The room's toilete, but its fine anyway.

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights/3 days at the end of March this year. Having booked the hotel for 18 girls travelling for a birthday weekend I was terrified after reading some of the reviews and in a panic tried to book somewhere else due to the proximity to the red light district & reviews on cleanliness.... Im glad I wasn't able to find somewhere else! We all had a great stay & a great weekend!!
reviews.title: Don't be put off

likes.disliked: — rude reception guy during check out

reviews.text: This is not a hotel for a romantic break or family holidays or for business travellers who need comfort but for singles or carefree couples its perfect for exploring the city. Just across the road from the central train station (around 4 euros each way for 15 min journey to/from airport) & lots of tram stops its ideally located. On the map it appears right on the edge of the red light district, which in a way it is, but its far enough away that we never felt insecure or in any danger. Nearly everything in the city centre is within walking distance so long as you have a pair of comfy shoes.
reviews.title: Should charge by the Hour

reviews.text: The hotel wasn't stylish but all 5 of our rooms were very clean & we had plenty of room. The bathrooms were spotless & the rooms were tidied each day. The stairs were indeed a nightmare but we didnt have to use them as the lift was always in perfect working order. Breakfast was fairly good and the hotel bar was cosy & friendly. The hotel staff were all very nice except for the guy at reception on the day we checked out who was very rude to 1 of the girls but otherwise we have no complaints at all.
reviews.title: Definitely not suitable for young families - we were assaulted

likes.disliked: — Noise, quite basic, room difficult to access

reviews.text: I book weekends away for my friends all the time & usually go for budget hotels. Some reviews seem to think that this hotel was overpriced.. we paid approx £90 each (with the current exchange rate) for our stay but the central location meant we didn't have any other expenses eg. taxi fares which for such a large group could have been a nightmare.
reviews.title: fantastic!!!

reviews.text: I cannot comment on the parts of the hotel located further down the street as we were all in the main building but we all had a very comfortable happy stay at this hotel & would certainly use it again.
reviews.title: absolutely loved it!
